lessons.title: Basic Pronunciation - Vowel Sounds
lessons.description: Master fundamental English vowel sounds with clear pronunciation practice

questions.text: The cat sat on the mat.
She likes to read books in the evening.
The sun shines bright in the sky.
I have a red car and a blue bike.
The dog runs fast in the park.

lessons.title: Common Phrases and Greetings
lessons.description: Learn essential English greetings and everyday phrases for daily communication

questions.text: Good morning, how are you today?
Nice to meet you, my name is Sarah.
Thank you very much for your help.
Excuse me, where is the bathroom?
Have a great day and see you later!

lessons.title: Numbers and Time
lessons.description: Master English numbers, telling time, and basic mathematical expressions

questions.text: It's three thirty in the afternoon.
I have twenty-five books on my shelf.
The meeting starts at nine o'clock sharp.
She was born on the fifteenth of March.
The train leaves at half past seven.

lessons.title: Family and Relationships
lessons.description: Learn vocabulary and expressions related to family members and relationships

questions.text: My grandmother lives with us in the same house.
My brother is older than my sister by two years.
We visit our relatives every Christmas holiday.
My uncle works as a doctor in the hospital.
I have a close relationship with my cousins.

lessons.title: Food and Dining
lessons.description: Essential vocabulary for ordering food, describing meals, and dining experiences

questions.text: I would like to order the grilled chicken with vegetables.
The soup tastes delicious and very hot.
Could you please bring me the dessert menu?
I'm allergic to nuts and dairy products.
The bill comes to forty-five dollars and fifty cents.

lessons.title: Intermediate Listening - Business Communication
lessons.description: Professional communication skills for workplace environments and business contexts

questions.text: The quarterly report will be presented to the board of directors next Friday.
We need to schedule a meeting to discuss the project timeline.
The client requested several modifications to the original proposal.
Our team achieved a significant increase in productivity this month.
The deadline for submitting the final report is next Wednesday.

lessons.title: Academic English - Research and Study
lessons.description: Formal academic language for research, studies, and scholarly communication

questions.text: The research methodology employed in this study follows established scientific protocols.
The hypothesis was supported by the experimental data collected over six months.
The literature review revealed significant gaps in current research.
Students must demonstrate critical thinking skills in their assignments.
The professor emphasized the importance of proper citation methods.

lessons.title: Advanced Conversation - Current Events
lessons.description: Complex discussions about current events, politics, and social issues

questions.text: The implementation of new policies requires careful consideration of all stakeholders.
Environmental sustainability has become a critical concern for modern businesses.
The economic implications of this decision cannot be underestimated.
Technological advancement has revolutionized modern communication methods.
International cooperation is essential for addressing global challenges.

lessons.title: Medical English - Healthcare Communication
lessons.description: Specialized vocabulary and expressions for healthcare professionals and medical contexts

questions.text: The patient's symptoms indicate a possible allergic reaction to the medication.
The surgical procedure was performed successfully without complications.
The diagnosis requires further examination and laboratory tests.
The treatment protocol includes both medication and physical therapy.
The patient's recovery depends on following the prescribed rehabilitation program.

lessons.title: Legal English - Professional Communication
lessons.description: Formal legal language and professional communication for legal contexts

questions.text: The contract stipulates that both parties must fulfill their obligations within the specified timeframe.
The court proceedings will commence at nine o'clock in the morning.
The defendant's attorney presented compelling evidence during the trial.
The settlement agreement requires mutual consent from all involved parties.
The legal precedent established by this case will influence future decisions.

listening.title: Listen Multiple Times
listening.content: Don't worry if you don't understand everything on the first listen. Play the audio 2-3 times to catch all the details.

listening.title: Focus on Key Words
listening.content: Pay attention to stressed syllables and important words. These usually carry the main meaning of the sentence.

listening.title: Use Headphones
listening.content: Good quality headphones can help you hear subtle pronunciation differences and background sounds more clearly.

listening.title: Adjust Playback Speed
listening.content: Use the speed control to slow down audio if you're a beginner, or speed it up as you improve.

listening.title: Listen for Rhythm
listening.content: English has natural rhythm patterns. Try to identify where speakers pause and which words they emphasize.

writing.title: Don't Edit While Typing
writing.content: Write what you hear first, then go back to check for mistakes. Editing while listening can distract you.

writing.title: Focus on Sounds, Not Spelling
writing.content: Sometimes what sounds right is more important than perfect spelling. Focus on capturing the sounds you hear.

writing.title: Use Punctuation Clues
writing.content: Listen for pauses that indicate commas, and falling intonation that suggests periods.

writing.title: Practice Common Words
writing.content: The most frequently used English words should become automatic. Practice writing them without thinking.

writing.title: Don't Panic on Mistakes
writing.content: Making mistakes is part of learning. Each error teaches you something new about English sounds and patterns.

general.title: Practice Daily
general.content: Even 15 minutes of daily practice is more effective than longer, infrequent sessions.

general.title: Set Realistic Goals
general.content: Start with easier sentences and gradually increase difficulty. Celebrate small improvements!

general.title: Learn from Mistakes
general.content: Review your errors to identify patterns. Are you missing certain sounds or word types?

general.title: Stay Motivated
general.content: Track your progress and reward yourself for achieving milestones. Learning takes time!

general.title: Use Multiple Resources
general.content: Combine dictation practice with reading, speaking, and listening to various English content.
